meanings.definition: A person or group that establishes or decrees something.
meanings.sent1: The ordainers of the school rules met to discuss new policies.
meanings.sent2: The ordainers in the government passed a new law.
meanings.sent3: The ordainers of the cookie jar declared a limit on daily treats.
meanings.sent4: She was the ordainer of fashion trends among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The ordainers of the land decided on the boundaries with care.

meanings.definition: Those who set rules or regulations.
meanings.sent1: The ordainers of the game explained the rules to the players.
meanings.sent2: The school board members were the ordainers of the dress code.
meanings.sent3: The ordainers of the household chores made a list for everyone.
meanings.sent4: He became the ordainer of order in the chaotic office.
meanings.sent5: The ordainers of the road signs ensured safety for all drivers.

meanings.sent1: The ordainers of the positions selected the new team leader.
meanings.sent2: The company's board of directors were the ordainers of promotions.
meanings.sent3: The ordainers of the tasks assigned roles for the project.
meanings.sent4: She was the ordainer of responsibilities in the group.
meanings.sent5: The ordainers of the awards ceremony chose the winners carefully.
